intro: Centaurea vorasana, commonly known as the Vorasana thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny foliage and purple to pink flower heads, which are composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flowers. Centaurea vorasana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
